summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from August 3, 2020, summarizing major news stories across various categories including criminal investigations, protests, counter-terrorism, and international relations. It contains a significant section on Ghislaine Maxwell's court case and newly unsealed documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, detailing allegations and connections to high-profile figures.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British socialite fighting sex-trafficking charges; won a temporary court ruling to prevent release of her 2016 deposition testimony in a civil case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker; his association with Maxwell and allegations of abuse are discussed in relation to newly unsealed documents.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: One of Epstein's accusers; her newly unsealed deposition alleges Maxwell was Epstein's chief accomplice and a participant in sexual abuse, and that she was recruited from Mar-a-Lago.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple contexts: wished Maxwell 'well', socialized with Epstein and Maxwell for years, demanded death penalty for Boston bomber, commented on TikTok, and his financial disclosure was released.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.role: Former President of the United States
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to Epstein's island; Giuffre said she saw him there, but a spokesperson denied he ever visited.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Allegedly directed by Maxwell and Epstein to have sex with Giuffre; he denies the allegations. New documents shed light on his friendship with Epstein.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Ruled that Maxwell's attorneys are not permitted to publicly identify accusers even if they've spoken publicly.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Mentioned regarding his House testimony on Portland protests, an op-ed suggesting he may try to spin the Durham investigation, and his support for an encryption bill.

persons.name: Mark Meadows
persons.context: Commented on unemployment benefit negotiations, stating there is 'a long ways to go'.

persons.name: Deborah Birx
persons.role: White House Coronavirus Task Force Response Coordinator
persons.context: Warned the nation has entered a 'new phase' of the pandemic; criticized by Speaker Pelosi.

persons.name: Anthony Fauci
persons.context: His testimony on the cause of increased US coronavirus cases was challenged by President Trump in a tweet.

persons.name: Mike Pompeo
persons.context: Said President Trump plans to take broad action on Chinese software like TikTok; criticized China's treatment of Uighurs.

persons.name: Graham Ivan Clark
persons.context: 17-year-old Florida teenager facing felony charges for hacking celebrity Twitter accounts in July 2020.

persons.name: Larry Householder
persons.context: His legislative office was raided by the FBI following his indictment on racketeering conspiracy charges related to a nuclear plant bailout scheme.

persons.name: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev
persons.context: Boston Marathon bomber whose death sentence was overturned by a federal appeals court; President Trump demanded the death penalty be sought again.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as Epstein's longtime companion and chief accomplice in sexual abuse and sex trafficking allegations.
Giuffre alleges Maxwell recruited her as a teenager from Mar-a-Lago to work for Epstein and participated in her abuse.
The document states Trump and Epstein socialized for years, attending parties and flying together on Epstein's plane, before a purported falling out.
The document states Trump and Maxwell mingled in the same social circles for at least 15 years after meeting in 1989.
Newly released documents shed light on their friendship, and Giuffre alleges Epstein directed her to have sex with the prince.
Giuffre testified she saw Clinton on Epstein's island and that Epstein said Clinton 'owes me a favor.' Clinton's spokesperson denies he ever visited.
Reported to have earned at least $36 million in outside income in 2019; both were clients of Deutsche Bank banker Rosemary Vrablic.

events.title: Maxwell Wins Temporary Block on Testimony Release
events.description: A federal appeals court temporarily halted the release of Ghislaine Maxwell's sworn testimony from a 2016 civil case, scheduling a hearing for September 22.

events.title: Epstein Case Documents Unsealed
events.description: Newly unsealed documents from a lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell included Virginia Giuffre's deposition alleging Maxwell's role in abuse and details about Epstein's connections to Prince Andrew and Bill Clinton.

events.title: First Circuit Overturns Tsarnaev Death Sentence
events.description: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the First Circuit overturned the death sentence of Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, ordering a new penalty-phase trial.

events.title: Trump Demands Death Penalty for Tsarnaev
events.description: President Trump tweeted that the federal government must again seek the death penalty for Tsarnaev following the appellate court's decision.

events.title: FBI Arrest in Twitter Hack
events.description: 17-year-old Graham Ivan Clark was arrested as the alleged mastermind behind the hack of celebrity Twitter accounts in July 2020, which involved a Bitcoin scam.

events.title: Indictment of Ohio Speaker Householder
events.description: Former Ohio House Speaker Larry Householder and four allies were indicted on racketeering conspiracy charges for an alleged $60 million bribery scheme related to a nuclear plant bailout.

events.title: Expiration of Federal Unemployment Benefits
events.description: Enhanced federal unemployment benefits of $600 per week expired, with negotiations between the White House and Congressional Democrats at an impasse.

locations: Little St. James Island (U.S. Virgin Islands)
Mark O. Hatfield Federal Courthouse (Portland, Oregon)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell won a temporary court ruling blocking the release of her 2016 deposition testimony in a civil case, with a hearing set for September 22, 2020.

Newly unsealed documents include Virginia Giuffre's deposition alleging Ghislaine Maxwell was Jeffrey Epstein's chief accomplice and a participant in sexual abuse, and that Giuffre was recruited from Trump's Mar-a-Lago club.

The documents also contain allegations about Prince Andrew's friendship with Epstein and claims that Giuffre saw former President Bill Clinton on Epstein's island, which Clinton's spokesperson denied.
A federal appeals court overturned the death sentence of Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, ordering a new penalty-phase trial.
The FBI News Briefing is a daily summary of major news stories compiled by Bulletin Intelligence for government and corporate leaders.
